channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API change for OS reinstallation
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 10, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 22, 22:51 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API offer.

This will affect some functionality.

Start time : 10/09/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 10/09/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, API will stop to accept SSH key id for OS reinstallation.

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API call removal
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 27, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

Jul 17, 14:35 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API.

The 27th of August 2024, the following API call will be definitely removed:
GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/templateCapabilities

Start time : 27/08/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 27/08/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : This API call was previously useful for old Windows OS installers that were not compatible with installation on another diskgroup on servers with multiple diskgroups.
Since then all OSes can be installed on any diskgroup.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [RBX7][Dedicated Servers] - Multiple racks incident notification
item.description:
Jul 22, 04:06 UTC
Update - The affected servers are slowly recovering.
Our teams continue to work to resolve this incident.

Jul 22, 02:55 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Jul 22, 01:22 UTC
Identified - Start time : 21/07/2024 22:45 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the following racks R713A01, R713A08, R713A07, R713A11, R715A01, R717A02, R713A03, R717A09 and R713A06 are no longer responding.
Root cause : Incident due to disjunction.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on a fix.

item.title: [BHS7][Dedicated Servers] - B715A06
item.description:
Jul 21, 22:40 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 21/07/2024 22:07 UTC
End time : 21/07/2024 22:15 UTC
Root cause : Due to a Kernel panic, the Vrack network was unreachable.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

End time : 21/07/2024 14:12 UTC

Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jul 21, 12:17 UTC

Jul 21, 12:10 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jul 21, 11:49 UTC

Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
